mapper.sql: id, summary_id, return_date, return_num, return_unit, statistics_num, return_color, create_time, mark
id, summary_id summaryId, return_date returnDate, return_num returnNum, return_unit returnUnit, statistics_num statisticsNum, return_color returnColor, create_time createTime, mark
mapper.select: select os.return_status returnStatus, os.id, os.order_date orderDate, (select name from factory_info where id=os.factory_id) factoryName, os.factory_code factoryCode, cloth_name clothName,pro.myCompanyCode,pro.myCompanyColor, (select name from technology_info where id=os.technology_id) technologyName, os.my_company_code myCompanyCode, pro.return_date returnDate, os.num,pro.technologyName, os.unit, pro.return_num returnNum, os.my_company_color myCompanyColor, pro.return_color returnColor,pro.mark from order_summary os left join return_goods_process pro on os.id=pro.summary_id

select
from return_goods_process order by id desc

select return_date returnDate, return_code returnCode, return_num returnNum, return_num_kg returnNumKg, cloth_name clothName,myCompanyCode,myCompanyColor, return_color returnColor, mark,zhiguan,technologyName, factory_name factoryName, kongcha,jiaodai from return_goods_process where summary_id=#{summaryId} order by id
select count(DISTINCT os.id) from return_goods_process gp,order_summary os where os.id = gp.summary_id and datediff(NOW(),gp.return_date) >#{_parameter}

mapper.update:
update return_goods_process
summary_id = #{summaryId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
return_date = #{returnDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
return_num = #{returnNum,jdbcType=INTEGER},
return_unit = #{returnUnit,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
statistics_num = #{statisticsNum,jdbcType=INTEGER},
return_color = #{returnColor,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
mark = #{mark,jdbcType=LONGVARCHAR},
factory_name = #{factoryName,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
